title: Pritzker Renews $400 Million Fund to Lure Companies to Illinois
description: Illinois Governor J.B. Pritzker is renewing a $400 million fund aimed at attracting businesses to the state as part of his annual budget.

title: Lara Trump Says ‘Every Penny’ of RNC Funds Would Go to Trump’s Bid
description: Lara Trump, Donald Trump’s daughter-in-law, said that she would direct every cent raised by the Republican National Committee to his White House comeback bid and winning majorities in Congress if she helped lead the organization.

title: Biden’s EV Vision Hits Supply Chain Snags With Sourcing Batteries
description: This is Washington Edition, the newsletter about money, power and politics in the nation’s capital. Today, metals and mining reporter Joe Deaux outlines the hurdles to building a US battery supply chain. Sign up here and follow us at @bpolitics. Email our editors here.

title: Hydro-Quebec’s CEO Says $137 Billion Power Plan Is Drawing Attention
description: The head of Hydro-Quebec said he’s confident the state-owned utility will find investors to back a massive expansion of a provincial electrical grid that’s expected to cost well over $100 billion.

title: Illinois Governor Proposes Fully Funding State Pensions by 2048
description: Illinois Governor J.B. Pritzker is proposing a plan to fully fund the state’s pensions by 2048 as he seeks to bolster the finances of the worst-rated US state.

title: Ukraine, IMF Near $900 Million Payment Amid Stalled US Aid
description: Ukraine is near an agreement with the International Monetary Fund to get the next $900 million disbursement from its $15.6 billion loan, a boost to the nation’s war-ravaged budget and a vote of confidence as US aid remains elusive.

title: UK’s House of Commons Descends Into Chaos Over Israel-Hamas War Vote
description: A vote on the Israel-Hamas war triggered chaotic scenes in the UK’s House of Commons with the Scottish National Party walking out of the chamber in protest and Prime Minister Rishi Sunak’s governing Conservatives refusing to cast their ballots.

title: Corporate Jet Use by Ultra-Wealthy Is Latest IRS Crackdown Push
description: The IRS is bringing the hammer down on the ultra-wealthy’s abuse of tax breaks on the use of corporate jets.

title: NYC Mayor Cancels Plan for Cuts to Libraries, Senior Services
description: New York City Mayor Eric Adams said he’ll no longer carry out a planned round of budget cuts that would have affected libraries, trash pickup and services to older adults.

title: Mali to Revamp Part of Its Energy Debt as Power Cuts Intensify
description: Mali is in talks with lenders to restructure loans made to the state energy company as it takes steps to address the sector’s shortcomings amid unprecedented power cuts.

title: California Moves Closer to Apologizing for the Harms of Slavery
description: California lawmakers took the state one step closer to becoming the first in the US to apologize for the harms of slavery, even though the practice was never legal there.

title: Illinois Eyes Sports-Betting Tax Hike for Fiscal 2025 Budget
description: Illinois Governor J.B. Pritzker is proposing a $52.7 billion budget for the year starting in July that raises levies on sports betting and extends caps on corporate tax deductions.

title: India Extends Parboiled Rice Export Tax to Control Prices
description: India, the world’s top rice exporter, extended a tax on outbound shipments of the parboiled variety to prevent any increase in domestic prices ahead of general elections.

title: EU Poised to Release Polish Aid Blocked in Rule of Law Clash
description: The European Union is poised to release €6.3 billion ($6.8 billion) in post-pandemic aid to Poland as early as next week in a major vote of confidence in the new government’s ability to mend ties with Brussels.

title: Romanian Top Parties Agree on Political Alliance for EU Election
description: Romania’s two ruling parties agreed to form a political alliance and field joint candidates in some of this year’s rounds of elections in an effort to limit the rise of an ultra-nationalistic party.

title: South Africa’s Budget Largesse Is Good News for ANC Before Vote
description: With three months to go before elections, South Africa’s finance minister delivered a budget that provided for vote-grabbing spending increases and a plan to contain debt that cheered investors.

title: New York Democrat Targets Victory in Hamptons After Suozzi Win
description: John Avlon, a political analyst for CNN, said Tom Suozzi’s decisive victory last week in the special election for the House seat vacated by George Santos showed how Democrats can win on Long Island. And he wants to prove it himself.

title: What the Two-State Solution for Israelis, Palestinians Means
description: The notion that Israelis and Palestinians can share the Holy Land living in separate, independent nations fueled on-and-off peace talks for more than 20 years. But the latest round foundered in 2014. In recent years, Israel has focused on making peace with Arab states, leaving the Palestinians with limited self-rule under the ultimate control of Israel. The Palestinian-Israeli violence that broke out in October challenged the idea that the status quo was sustainable, reviving calls by, among oth

title: Tax Cuts and Floppy Tridents: The Readout With Allegra Stratton
description: We’re two weeks away from what could be Chancellor Jeremy Hunt’s last budget before the election, and he appears to have had some good news. Britain’s economy delivered the “biggest budget surplus on record in January,” according to Bloomberg’s economics team, thanks to money pouring in from “strong VAT, personal and corporation tax receipts.” The government spent less too, “helped by lower debt-interest costs and the withdrawal of energy support schemes,” write my colleagues Andrew Atkinson and

title: EU Finance Chiefs Set to Discuss Bigger EIB Role, Eyeing Defense
description: European national flags fly outside European Investment Bank (EIB) Eastbuilding in Luxembourg, on Monday, March 15, 2021. More than 60 financial firms have established operations in the Grand Duchy due to Brexit, according to Nicolas Mackel, the head of Luxembourg for Finance. Photographer: Olivier Matthys/Bloomberg

title: University of Alabama Pauses IVF Treatment After State’s Ruling
description: The University of Alabama at Birmingham has paused IVF treatments as it examines a ruling by the state’s Supreme Court that determined that frozen embryos should be considered children.

title: US Says Former FBI Informant Had Ties to Russia Intelligence
description: An informant charged with lying to the FBI about Hunter Biden and his father’s ties to Ukrainian energy company Burisma Holdings had numerous contacts with Russian intelligence operatives, US prosecutors wrote in a court filing.

title: Strikes Pile Up in Argentina Amid Sting of Milei’s Shock Therapy
description: Labor disruptions are gaining steam in Argentina as unions dig in their heels against austerity measures imposed by President Javier Milei that are denting wages and pensions.

title: Haley Pitches Herself as Alternative to Criminal Defendant Trump
description: Nikki Haley lit into her rival for the Republican presidential nomination, Donald Trump, saying that primary voters will see her as a viable alternative to the frontrunner as he becomes increasingly mired in legal jeopardy.

title: Global Conflicts Turn Sleepy G-20 Forum Into High-Stakes Affair
description: The international outcry over Brazil comparing Israel’s actions in Gaza to the genocide during World War II has turned a typically sleepy gathering of Group of 20 foreign ministers into a high-stakes affair.

title: Strong Immigration Helps Slow Canada’s Population Aging
description: Canada’s population aging slowed for a second straight year as a result of strong immigration, including a recent boom in foreign students and temporary workers.

title: Trump Campaign Spent More Than It Raised, While PAC Helped on Legal Fees
description: Donald Trump’s campaign spent more than it raised in January, a worrying sign for the Republican 2024 presidential frontrunner whose broader political operation is also funding his legal fees.

title: Zelenskiy Urges Tusk, EU Meeting to Resolve Border Blockade
description: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskiy called for a meeting with Poland’s prime minister and the European Commission to help resolve a spat over grain shipments after Polish farmers blocked border crossings and disrupted imports.

title: Sunak Team’s War of Words on Post Office Scandal Spurs Backlash
description: Months out from a UK election and trailing in the polls, Prime Minister Rishi Sunak is desperate to move past what’s been described as the biggest scandal in British legal history: the thousands of storekeepers falsely accused of stealing from the Post Office franchises they were running.

title: Post Office Questions: Keir Starmer Presses PM Over Badenoch Comments
description: Get caught up on the day’s political news

title: South Africa Announces Tax Breaks to Kick-Start EV Industry
description: South Africa took a belated step to preserve one of its key export industries by announcing a major tax-break for investments in the production of electric and hydrogen-powered vehicles.

title: UK Mulls Restricting Arms Sales to Israel If It Goes Into Rafah
description: The UK government is considering restricting some arms exports to Israel if it launches an offensive on the Palestinian city of Rafah or obstructs aid trucks from entering Gaza, people familiar with the matter said.

title: Tougher Curbs Needed on Grain From Russian-Occupied Ukraine
description: Restrictions need to be tightened to prevent grain from Russian-occupied Ukraine entering the global market via Swiss-based commodity traders, according to an advocacy group.

title: UK Treasury Committee Chair Blasts IMF for No-Show
description: The chair of an influential panel of UK lawmakers has accused the International Monetary Fund of dodging scrutiny over its latest forecasts and attacked its “infuriating” behavior.

title: Poland Seeks EU’s Help to Resolve Farmers Dispute at Ukraine Border
description: Poland’s government has appealed to the European Union’s executive arm to help defuse a dispute with Ukraine over grain shipments after farmers blocked border crossings and disrupted imports.

title: South African Rand Jumps as Nation Taps Reserves for Debt
description: The rand strengthened and local bond yields dropped after South Africa said it will tap its gold and foreign-exchange reserves to reduce the scale of its public debt sales.

title: Highlights of South African Finance Minister Godongwana’s Budget
description: Below are the highlights of South Africa’s 2024 budget released by Finance Minister Enoch Godongwana in Cape Town on Wednesday.

title: South Africa Plans New Tax Measures, EV Manufacturing Incentives
description: South Africa’s National Treasury unveiled a series of measures to boost revenue by 15 billion rand ($793 million) to alleviate immediate fiscal pressures and plans longer-term changes to the tax regime.

title: South Africa Lowers Borrowing Requirement on Reserves Drawdown
description: National Treasury lowers gross borrowing requirement through drawdown from the Gold and Foreign Exchange Contingency Reserve Account, according to Budget Review published in Cape Town on Wednesday.

title: Betting Against Lula Means Missing Out on Brazilian Bank’s 76% Return
description: Brazil’s second-biggest bank handed shareholders returns of 76% last year, proving traders wrong who bet President Luiz Inácio Lula da Silva would hurt the company’s performance by using it to juice the nation’s economy.

title: Ukraine Disputes Russia Claim on Bridgehead Seizure
description: Ukraine said its military continues to defend a narrow strip of land in Russian-occupied territory along the southern bend of the Dnipro River, after Russia’s defense minister told President Vladimir Putin it had been seized by his forces.

title: Russia Bans UK Ships From Fishing in Its Waters
description: The Russian State Duma has banned British ships from fishing, including cod, in Russia’s Arctic waters and along the coast of the Kola Peninsula.

title: The Group of 20 Has Never Looked More Broken Than in Rio
description: Welcome to Balance of Power, bringing you the latest in global politics. If you haven’t yet, sign up here.

title: BAE Cautions Delivering More Weapons to Ukraine Will Take Time
description: BAE Systems Plc cautioned that it will take time to gear up weapons shipments to Ukraine, amid mounting pressure to bolster supplies as Russia makes gains on the battlefield.

title: What to Expect In the 2024 South Africa Budget Speech
description: Enoch Godongwana Photographer: Dwayne Senior/Bloomberg

title: US-India Ties to Grow No Matter Who Wins Election, Group Says
description: US-India relations are mature and will continue to grow irrespective of the winner in this year’s US presidential election, according to a top trade group working with New Delhi and Washington to enhance commercial ties.

title: Turkey’s Fifth-Generation Fighter Jet Kaan Makes Maiden Flight
description: Turkey’s fifth-generation fighter jet in development conducted its first ever flight on Wednesday, a milestone for the country to deploy domestically produced war planes.

title: US Citizens Become Collateral Damage in Global Sanctions Fight
description: Americans with roots in targeted countries face heightened scrutiny from banks fearing fines for violations.

title: Biden Cancels $1.2 Billion of Federal Student Loans
description: President Joe Biden’s administration announced that more than 150,000 borrowers will receive $1.2 billion in student loan forgiveness under a program unveiled in January seeking to provide relief for Americans who had been making payments for at least a decade.

title: Biden Seeks to Bolster Port Cybersecurity With Executive Order
description: President Joe Biden will sign an executive order designed to implement new cybersecurity requirements for the nation’s port owners and operators amid growing concerns that hackers could roil crucial supply chains.

title: France Pledges More Help for Farmers to Stop Protests Reigniting
description: French Prime Minister Gabriel Attal pledged a new law aimed at ensuring fair prices for farmers among other measures as he seeks to make good on promises to answer their concerns after weeks of nationwide protests.

title: EU Approves More Russia Sanctions Following Navalny’s Death
description: The European Union approved a modest new package of sanctions ahead of the two-year mark since Russia invaded Ukraine and following the death of opposition leader Alexey Navalny in a Russian prison.

title: UK Plans Sanctions Against Officers at Prison Where Navalny Died
description: The UK government is preparing a sanctions package targeting prison officers at the jail where Russian opposition leader Alexey Navalny died, people familiar with the matter said.

title: Iran Says Israel Behind Attack on Gas Pipeline Network
description: Iran blamed Israel for an attack on its gas transmission network last week that caused supply disruptions to some villages in the Persian Gulf country.

title: Seizing Frozen Russian Assets Over Ukraine War Wins Endorsement of Legal Experts
description: A group of legal experts sought to bolster the case for seizing frozen Russian central bank assets, arguing that such actions are allowed under international law given the scale of Russia’s continuing attacks in Ukraine.

title: Japan Protests As Firm’s Funds Tapped For S. Korea Compensation
description: Japan protested to South Korea’s ambassador after Japanese company funds lodged with a Seoul court were paid out as compensation over colonial-era forced labor, a step Tokyo said was a breach of a 1965 treaty.

title: Italy Weighs Sale of New Stake in Monte Paschi to Cut Debt
description: Italy’s government is considering selling a stake of up to 10% in lender Banca Monte dei Paschi di Siena SpA in a bid to cut debt and facilitate consolidation in the banking sector.

title: Polish Central Bank Rebuffs Claims It Misled Cabinet Over Profit
description: Poland’s central bank has sought to reject criticism that it misled the government over its finances, saying its 2023 result was undercut by 31 billion zloty ($7.8 billion) at the end of last year due to the strong zloty.

title: UK Posts Record Fiscal Surplus in Pre-Budget Boost for Hunt
description: Britain delivered the biggest budget surplus on record in January, a boost for Chancellor Jeremy Hunt two weeks before he is due to announce what could be the last fiscal statement before a general election.

title: Bloomberg Politics
description: Bloomberg.com.

title: Deepfake Audio Boom Exploits One Billion-Dollar Startup’s AI
description: ElevenLabs’ technology is already being used to spoof political candidates and promote scammy products.

title: The Dangers of Relying on the US to Power the Global Economy
description: High interest rates and the strong dollar are a burden for emerging markets, but China and Europe show no signs of taking the lead.

title: War in Ukraine Is Turning in Putin’s Favor After Months of Stalemate
description: Russia has regained the initiative and put Volodymyr Zelenskiy on the back foot.

title: Five Things to Watch For in South Africa’s Pre-Election Budget
description: South African Finance Minister Enoch Godongwana will table his annual budget on Wednesday in the lead up to elections that opinion polls show will deprive the ruling African National Congress of a parliamentary majority for the first time in three decades.

title: Fund Manager Turned Finance Minister Wants to Revive Poland’s Stock Market
description: Poland’s new finance minister is aiming to give its faltering stock market a boost by spurring investment in energy transition and encouraging state-owned companies to pay more in dividends.

title: Swiss Vote to Boost Pensions May Be Close Call, Poll Shows
description: A plan to boost Swiss pensions by giving retirees a 13th monthly payment each year is losing support and may struggle to pass in a national vote next month, according to the final poll before the March 3 ballot.

title: Japan’s Chip Spree Aims to Kick Economy Into High Gear
description: Kishida hopes new semiconductor plants will raise wages in regions and stop exodus of people to big cities.

title: Trump Compares His Legal Woes to Late Russian Dissident Navalny
description: Republican presidential frontrunner Donald Trump drew parallels between his litany of court cases and the recent death of Russian dissident Alexey Navalny, defending previous comments that he made on his Truth Social media platform.

title: Hong Kong Is Over Unless China Fixes Its Own Economy, Roach Says
description: China must fix its economy and let Hong Kong run itself if it wants a better future for the financial hub, former Morgan Stanley Asia Ltd. chair Stephen Roach said, after a pessimistic column he wrote sparked an uproar.

title: Houthis Fire at Ship Carrying Humanitarian Aid to Yemen, US Says
description: Houthi militants in Yemen on Tuesday fired two missiles at a ship carrying humanitarian assistance to the country, according to US Central Command.

title: South Korean Doctors Widen Walk Out to Protest More Seats at Med Schools
description: Nearly 8,000 South Korean trainee doctors have not reported for work in a protest against a government plan to increase the number of seats at medical schools, which is aimed at reversing a shortage of physicians.

title: Winklevoss Twins Give $4.9 Million to Crypto Super PAC
description: Fairshake, the crypto super political action committee that’s raked in millions in recent months, raised $4.9 million from billionaire twins Cameron Winklevoss and Tyler Winklevoss, according to its latest federal filings.

title: China-Europe Ties Worsen on Ukraine and Disputes Over Trade
description: A recent gathering of world leaders and military officials in southern Germany exposed the growing divisions between the European Union and China over the bloc’s biggest security concern — the war in Ukraine.

title: Taib Mahmud, Malaysian Tycoon Linked to Logging, Dies at 87
description: Taib Mahmud, the politician and tycoon who became known for enabling the destruction of rainforests in Malaysia’s biggest state in pursuit of economic development, has passed away due to illness. He was 87.

title: Australian Writer Yang Says He Won’t Appeal China Death Sentence
description: Australian writer Yang Hengjun has announced he won’t appeal a suspended death sentence imposed by a Chinese court in early February, a ruling that has clouded the outlook for relations between Canberra and Beijing following a recent improvement.

title: UK Trident Nuclear Missile Test Fails for Second Time
description: Labour has called for assurances over the effectiveness of Britain's nuclear deterrent after "concerning" reports about a Trident missile test failure.

title: Hunt Has £23 Billion for UK Tax Cuts, Resolution Estimates
description: UK Chancellor Jeremy Hunt will have £23 billion ($29.1 billion) of headroom for pre-election tax cuts in his budget next month but any giveaways will be “sandwiched between far bigger past and future tax rises,” according to the Resolution Foundation.

title: Thailand Aims Clampdown on Recreational Cannabis by Year-End
description: Thailand wants to ban recreational use of cannabis by the end of this year, the nation’s health minister said, threatening to put thousands of marijuana shops and farms that have sprung up around the country since a decriminalization drive two years ago out of business.

title: Hong Kong Faces Mounting Pressure to Remove Property Curbs
description: Hong Kong’s influential developer association and politicians are putting pressure on the government to remove extra property taxes to lift the lackluster market.
